node.title: Some N.F.L. Teams Face a Financial Cliff Despite Raised Salary Cap
node.description: The New Orleans Saints and Green Bay Packers, beset by hefty long-term contracts, will be forced into personnel decisions in 2022.

node.title: ‘The Music Man’ Once Had a Disabled Character. Then He Was Erased.
node.description: At the urging of producers, Meredith Willson cut a boy in a wheelchair from the early scripts for his 1957 musical. A look back shows what was lost.

node.title: The Year in Pictures 2021
node.description: While many people, fearing the virus, continued to stay close to home, photographers traveled the world, documenting the world‘s turmoil and triumphs.

node.title: Flooding and slips affecting motorists around the country
node.description: Heavy rain is causing slips and flooding around the country, affecting motorists across the regions.

node.title: 'Simply eating dinner felt like an intense workout': Reporter Charles Brice spent two weeks in hospital with COVID-19
node.description: ABC News Breakfast reporter Charles Brice tested positive to COVID-19 and spent two weeks in hospital recovering. Here's what he discovered along the way.

node.title: Curry burns NBA 3-point record
node.description: The Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry has set the NBA's all-time 3-point record making his 2,974th long-range shot.

node.title: Nelson resource consents delayed by council staff shortage
node.description: A shortage of planning staff and high demand for services is causing delays in building and resource consents being granted in Nelson.

node.title: Wellington council allowed to strengthen quake-prone Toomath's Buildings - High Court
node.description: The High Court has ruled Wellington City Council has the right to do seismic strengthening on two heritage buildings - and recover the costs from the reluctant owners later.

node.title: Lower North Island residents asked to watch out for wallabies
node.description: The Greater Wellington Regional Council is asking the public keep an eye out for the marsupials in Upper Hutt and Featherston.

node.title: NASA probe is first spacecraft to enter the sun's atmosphere
node.description: The Parker Solar Probe has braved 2 million degree Fahrenheit heat to do what was previously thought impossible.

node.title: Muslim Lawmaker Comes Under Fire in House Debate on ‘Islamophobia’
node.description: A conservative Republican accused Ilhan Omar, the sponsor of a House bill to combat anti-Muslim bias, of terrorist sympathies.

node.title: House Votes 222-208 to Hold Mark Meadows in Contempt of Congress
node.description: The House voted 222-208 to levy charges against the former Trump chief of staff.

node.title: Official confirms fireball from overturned petrol tanker kills 75 in Haiti
node.description: At least 75 people have died after a petrol tanker overturned and exploded in northern Haiti, unleashing a fireball that swept through homes and businesses.

node.title: Report reveals performance gap between regions with Covid-19 restrictions and those with fewer
node.description: The latest Westpac Regional Roundup report shows the emergence of the Delta variant created a performance gap between regions that had fewer restrictions, and those that were forced into lockdown.

node.title: Coroner in tears at loss of 'beautiful boy' Bailey Mackander as she closes death-in-custody inquest
node.description: An emotional deputy State Coroner criticises the young detainee's guards, apologises to his parents and delivers recommendations she says she has no confidence will make any difference.

node.title: Angelina Jolie visits Capitol Hill
node.description: The actress and filmmaker had previously visited the Capitol in September to support the re-authorization of the Violence Against Women Act.

node.title: Sergio Correa Convicted For Killing 2 With Baseball Bat, Stabbing Their Son 60-Plus Times
node.description: Sergio Correa, 30, was found guilty by a Connecticut state jury of 13 of 14 charges, which included murder with special circumstances.

node.title: Mass walkout by SA prison guards who don't want to eat food prepared by inmates
node.description: A mass walk-out of prison guards over food, pay and conditions leaves a skeleton crew at one of South Australia’s largest prisons.

node.title: Primary sector exports tipped to exceed $50bn in 2022 - report
node.description: The Ministry for Primary Industries' situation and outlook report says dairy is expected to drive the gains.

node.title: Petition signers fight to retain carparks in Wellington's Thorndon Quay
node.description: Wellington City Council's decision to cut half the carparks from Thorndon Quay is costing businesses customers and making the area less safe, say locals.

node.title: Covid-19 outbreak and lockdown hits government coffers
node.description: The government's finances have taken a bigger than expected hit from the current Covid-19 outbreak.

node.title: Covid-19: 74 new community cases today, one death
node.description: There are 74 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today as Auckland's border restrictions are lifted.

node.title: Bipartisan lawmakers call on Biden to speed up lethal aid to Ukraine
node.description: Members of the House Armed Services Committee visited Ukraine on a three-day codel over the weekend.

node.title: Injured Telstra linesmen told they must take job against doctors' orders
node.description: A group of injured Telstra service technicians claim they are being forced to take unsuitable jobs or resign. Their lawyer is calling for them to be given appropriate work or be medically retired.

node.title: Citrus foam served in lips and a teaspoon of crab: 'Uniquely bad' restaurant saga takes a new turn
node.description: It started with a meal out, and ended with a viral review and a hand-drawn picture of a horse (a tale as old as time, right?).

node.title: Changes to Victoria's COVID-19 rules are about to come into effect. Here's what you need to know
node.description: Omicron is looming, but some rules about mask-wearing and showing your vaccination status will be relaxed at 11:59pm tonight. In the meantime, authorities say, they are carefully monitoring the new variant.

node.title: Hunter COVID cases double after superspreader event, majority tipped to be Omicron
node.description: NSW Health says more than a third of the 650 people who checked into the Argyle House nightclub last week have now tested positive.

node.title: Remote community residents test positive for COVID-19 at Royal Darwin Hospital as outbreak grows by 4
node.description: The Northern Territory has recorded four new COVID-19 cases linked to the current outbreak, including two Timber Creek residents who tested positive at Royal Darwin Hospital.

node.title: House Debate on ‘Islamophobia’ Devolves Into Attack on Muslim Lawmaker
node.description: A conservative Republican accused Ilhan Omar, the sponsor of a House bill to create an envoy to combat Islamophobia, of terrorist sympathies.

node.title: Fox News: Ingraham, Hannity, Kilmeade 'Stand by' 1/6 Texts and Contradictory On-Air Comments
node.description: Fox stated that they have "widely condemned" the attacks of January 6.
